item.title: Andria add a quote by Robert Jordan
item.description: "The Creator made women to please the eye, and to boggle the mind." -- Robert Jordan

item.title: Andria add a quote by Stephenie Meyer
item.description: "He's like a drug for you, Bella." -- Stephenie Meyer

item.title: Andria add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Andria add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I wish it need not have happened in my time," said Frodo. "So do I," said Gandalf, "and so do all who live to see such times. But that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Andria add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I don't know half of you half as well as I should like; and I like less than half of you half as well as you deserve." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Andria add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "In sorrow we must go, but not in despair. Behold! we are not bound for ever to the circles of the world, and beyond them is more than memory." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Andria add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "The Road goes ever on and on Down from the door where it began. Now far ahead the Road has gone, And I must follow, if I can, Pursuing it with eager feet, Until it joins some larger way Where many paths and errands meet. And whither then? I cannot say" -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Andria add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Deserves it! I daresay he does. Many that live deserve death. And some that die deserve life. Can you give it to them? Then do not be too eager to deal out death in judgement. For even the very wise cannot see all ends." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Andria add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "If more of us valued food and cheer and song above hoarded gold, it would be a merrier world." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Andria add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Faithless is he that says farewell when the road darkens." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Andria add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Ónen i-estel edain, ú-chebin estel anim. (I gave Hope to the Dúnedain, I have kept none for myself.) (Gilraen's linnod)" -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Andria add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Where did you go to, if I may ask?' said Thorin to Gandalf as they rode along. To look ahead,' said he. And what brought you back in the nick of time?' Looking behind,' said he." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Andria add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "He that breaks a thing to find out what it is has left the path of wisdom." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Andria add a quote by Mercedes Lackey
item.description: "One day,' Orest said, looking at him comically, 'you will say something that is less than practical and sensible, something that is driven by no forethought and nothing but passion, and I will probably collapse with shock." -- Mercedes Lackey

item.title: Andria add a quote by Mercedes Lackey
item.description: "Truth and trust are the means by which civilization holds off barbarism." -- Mercedes Lackey

item.title: Andria add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Andria add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "When I do good, I feel good. When I do bad, I feel bad. That's my religion." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Andria add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "America will never be destroyed from the outside. If we falter and lose our freedoms, it will be because we destroyed ourselves." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Andria add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Tact: the ability to describe others as they see themselves." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Andria add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "If you once forfeit the confidence of your fellow citizens, you can never regain their respect and esteem. It is true that you may fool all of the people some of the time; you can even fool some of the people all of the time; but you can't fool all of the people all of the time. -Speech at Clinton, Illinois, September 8, 1854." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Andria add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Whatever you are, be a good one." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Andria add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "A house divided against itself cannot stand." I believe this government cannot endure, permanently half slave and half free. I do not expect the Union to be dissolved — I do not expect the house to fall — but I do expect it will cease to be divided. It will become all one thing or all the other." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Andria add a quote by Robert Jordan
item.description: "Any fool knows men and women think differently at times, but the biggest difference is this. Men forget, but never forgive; women forgive, but never forget." -- Robert Jordan

item.title: Andria add a quote by Robert Jordan
item.description: "The fact that the price must be paid is proof it is worth paying." -- Robert Jordan

item.title: Andria add a quote by Robert Jordan
item.description: "The Wheel of Time turns, and Ages come and pass, leaving memories that become legend. Legend fades to myth, and even myth is long forgotten when the Age that gave it birth comes again." -- Robert Jordan
